result.execSummary:
The defendant Bill Walter Lamers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bill Walter Lamers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bill Walter Lamers was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bill Walter Lamers was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bill Walter Lamers

records.addlTxt: 10:30 AM Defendant Bill Walter Lamers in court.  Attorney Henry Francis Mcroberts in court for Bill Walter Lamers.  Attorney Charles James Simono appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Count 1, but read in. Court dismisses Count 1, but read in upon State's motion. Defendant pleads guilty to Counts 2 & 3. Plea is freely, voluntarily, and intelligently given. Court finds defendant guilty on Counts 2 & 3, due to guilty plea.  Statement by State. Statement by Attorney McRoberts. Statement by Court. Statement by Victim. Statement by Attorney McRoberts. Statement by Court. Court imposes and withholds 90 days jail on Count 2, imposes court costs to be paid within 60 days or commitment order. Ct. 3 Court imposes and stays 90 days jail, withholds sentence places defendant on probation for two years with conditions: must complete AODA assessment with follow through, must undergo psychological evaluation, must attend anger management, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no consumption of possession of marijuana, must maintain full time employment or schooling, must take medications as prescribed, must attend two AA/NA meetings per week, vivtrol if available or skram (up to agent), no contact with J. R. unless she agrees and approved by probation, pay court costs, 45 days jail. Must submit DNA sample. Appeal rights given. Adj. 11:05am jjm
Final pre-trial on October 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No consumption of alcohol, no possession of alcohol, not to enter any bars or taverns, no violent contact with victim, upon request of law enforcement with probable cause submit to evidentiary sample of breath or blood to determine the presence of alcohol or drugs.

10:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bill Walter Lamers in court.  Attorney Henry Francis Mcroberts in court for Bill Walter Lamers. Statement by Attorney Simono. Preliminary hearing waived. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over. Defendant enters not guilty plea. Court continues bond. Attorney Simono request bond modification. Court modifies bond no consumption of alcohol, no possession of alcohol, not to enter any bars or taverns, no violent contact with victim, upon request of law enforcement with probable cause submit to evidentiary sample of breath or blood to determine the presence of alcohol or drugs. Adj. 10:35am jjm
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
